item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, May 19, 2025 at 1:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. France Becomes First Government to Endorse UN Open Source Principles (241 points | 49 comments)
2. Spaced repetition systems have gotten better (695 points | 420 comments)
3. Show HN: I modeled the Voynich Manuscript with SBERT to test for structure (269 points | 80 comments)
4. Ditching Obsidian and building my own (230 points | 261 comments)
5. Show HN: Vaev – A browser engine built from scratch (It renders google.com) (117 points | 50 comments)
6. New research reveals the strongest solar event ever detected, in 12350 BC (16 points | discuss)
7. Show HN: A platform to find tech conferences, discounts, and ticket giveaways (41 points | 11 comments)
8. $30 Homebrew Automated Blinds Opener (183 points | 76 comments)
9. Spaced Repetition Memory System (155 points | 16 comments)
10. K-Scale Labs: Open-source humanoid robots, built for developers (53 points | 30 comments)
11. Comparing Parallel Functional Array Languages: Programming and Performance (49 points | 9 comments)
12. A New Headache for Honest Students: Proving They Didn't Use A.I (49 points | 36 comments)
13. The Journal of Imaginary Research (10 points | 1 comment)
14. Show HN: Python Simulator of David Deutsch’s "Constructor Theory of Time" (49 points | 6 comments)
15. Show HN: Buckaroo – Data table UI for Notebooks (80 points | 6 comments)
16. Green Fabrication of Sulfonium-Containing Bismuth Materials for X-Ray Detection (5 points | 1 comment)
17. Building my childhood dream PC (147 points | 62 comments)
18. KDE is finally getting a native virtual machine manager called "Karton" (60 points | 16 comments)
19. In Memoriam: John L. Young, Cryptome Co-Founder (165 points | 17 comments)
20. Dezyne Programming Language (29 points | 3 comments)
21. Emergent social conventions and collective bias in LLM populations (44 points | 14 comments)
22. Show HN: Hardtime.nvim – break bad habits and master Vim motions (164 points | 64 comments)
23. The Fall of Roam (88 points | 40 comments)
24. How the humble chestnut traced the rise and fall of the Roman Empire (40 points | 4 comments)
25. Yahtzeeql – Yahtzee solver that's mostly SQL (16 points | 7 comments)
26. Mystical (358 points | 42 comments)
27. How the Sun Enterprise 10000 was born (2007) (54 points | 54 comments)
28. AniSora: Open-source anime video generation model (326 points | 186 comments)
29. Show HN: Model2vec-Rs – Fast Static Text Embeddings in Rust (50 points | 5 comments)
30. Hyper Typing (42 points | 37 comments)
